episode_title: 219 - The One Where Eddie Won’t Go
note: [Scene: Chandler’s bedroom. Chandler is sleeping and Eddie is there watching him.]

content.text: [Chandler wakes up]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Eddie. Daahh!! What’re you doin’ here?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Nothin’ roomie, just watchin’ you sleep.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Makes me feel um, peaceful, heh-heh, please.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t sleep now.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: You want me to sing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, look, that’s it, it’s over, I want you out, I want you out of the apartment now.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Woah, woah, woah, what’re, what’re you talkin’ about man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hannibal Lecter…better roommate than you.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: No. See now I don’t think you’re being fair. I mean one night you see me and you get scared, I mean, what about all the other nights when you don’t see me, huh? What about last night when you went and got a drink of water and I was nice enough to hide behind the door, what’s that about, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t realize that.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: GET OUT NOW!!

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Ok, you really want me out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes please.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Ok, then I want to hear you say it, I, I want to hear you say you want me out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I want you out.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: No no no, I wanna hear it from your lips.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where did you hear it from before?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Oh, right, all right, you know what pallie I understand, consider me gone, you know what, I’ll be out by the time you get home from work tomorrow.
[Eddie leaves the room and Chandler mouths “Thank you” to himself]

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: I heard that.

content.description: Central Perk. Monica and Rachel are there, Joey enters wearing an old looking hat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey. Whe-ell, look at you, finally got that time machine workin’ huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seriously, you like it? This guy was sellin’ them on 8th avenue and I looked at ’em and I though, you know what I don’t have?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A mirror?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine, make fun. I think it’s jaunty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, for a guy who’s recently lost his job, you’re in an awfully good mood.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I’ll be alright. I mean it’s not like I’m starting from sqare one. I was Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives . Heh? I mean that’s gotta have some kind of cache.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cache? Jaunty?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler gave me word of the day toilet paper. I’m gonna get some coffee.
[Phoebe enters]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh, so so so, did you read the book?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, it was incredible.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Didn’t it like totally speak to you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Woah, woah, woah, what book is this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel you have to read this book. It’s called Be Your Own Windkeeper . It’s about how women need to become more empowered.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah and oh, and but there’s, there’s wind and the wind can make us Goddesses. But you know who takes out wind? Men, they just take it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Men just take out wind?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ya-huh, all the time, cause they are the lightning bearers.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that sounds kinda cool, kinda like The Hobbit .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It is nothing like the Hobbit. It’s like reading about every relationship I’ve ever had, except for Richard.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yes, no, Richard would never steal your wind.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, ’cause he’s yummy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes. But all the other ones.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yes. Oh and, the part about how they’re always like drinking from out pool of inner power, but God forbid we should take a sip.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anybody want a croan.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, this is a typical lightning-bearer thing. Right there, it’s like, um, ‘Hello, who wants one of my fallic shaped man cakes?’

content.description: Estelle Leonard Talent Agency.Joey is there.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Don’t worry about it already. Things happen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, you’re not mad at me for getting fired and everything?

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Joey, look at me, look at me. Do I have lipstick on my teeth?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, can we get back to me?

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Look honey, people get fired left and right in this business. I already got you an audition for Another World .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright. Cab driver number two?

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But I was Dr. Drake Remoray. How can I go from bein’ a neurosurgeon to drivin’ a cab?

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Things change, roll with em.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But this is a two line part, it’s like takin’ a step backwards. I’m not gonna do this.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Joey, I’m gonna tell you the same thing I told Al Minser and his pyramid of dogs. Take any job you can get and don’t make on the floor.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry. See ya.

content.description: Central Perk. Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are there. Rachel has just finished reading the book.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God, oh, God, I mean it’s just so.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Isn’t it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, I mean this is like reading about my own life. I mean this book could have been called ‘Be Your Own Windkeeper Rachel’.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t think it would have sold a million copies but it would have made a nice gift for you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey you guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, sweetie we’ve gotta go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: NO!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, why do we always have to do everything according to your time table?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually it’s the movie theatre that has the time schedule. So you don’t miss the beginning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, see this isn’t about the movie theatre, this is about you stealing my wind.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You go girl. I can’t pull that off can I?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me, your, your, your wind?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, my wind. How do you expect me to grow if you won’t let me blow?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You, you know I, I don’t, have a- have a problem with that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I just, I just really need to be with myself right now. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um-um, um-um.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re right, I don’t have to apologize. Sorry. Damnit!

content.description: Joey’s apartment. Joey and Ross enter.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I, I don’t know, it’s got all this stuff about wind and trees and there’s some kind of sacred pool in it. I mean, I don’t really get it but she’s, she’s pretty upset about it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See, this is why I don’t date women who read. Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, what’s that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s my VISA bill. Envelope one of two. That can’t be good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Open it, open in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Woah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at this, how did I spend so much money?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh Joey, that’s just the minumum amount due, that’s your total due.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, woah, woah, $3500 at porcelain safari?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My animals. Hey the guy said they suited me, he spoke with an accent, I was all confused. I don’t know what I’m gonna do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I guess you can start by drivin a cab on Another World .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That audition.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s a two line part.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, you owe $1100 at I Love Lucite.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So suck it up man, it’s a job, it’s money.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, look, I don’t need you getting all judgemental and condescending and pedantic.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Toilet paper?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I’m not being any of those things, ok, I’m just being realistic.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well knock it off, you’re supposed to be my friend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am your friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well then tell me things like, ‘Joey you’ll be fine,’ and, ‘Hang in there,’ and, and, ’somethin’ big’s fonna come along, I know it.’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But I don’t know it. What I do know is that you owe $2300 at Isn’t it Chromantic.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross, I’m aware of what I owe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, well then get some sense. I mean it took you what, 10 years to get that job, who knows how long it’s gonna be till you get another.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I don’t wanna hear this right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh, I’m just saying…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well don’t just say.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ya know, maybe, maybe I should just go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok. I’ll see ya later. Just think about it, ok.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t need to think about it. I was Dr. Drake Remoray. That was huge. Big things are gonna happen, you’ll see. Ross, you still there?

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. Chandler peeks in the door. He doesn’t see Eddie so he enters, breathing a sigh of relief. Eddie pops up from behind the bar.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Hey pal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhhh-gaaaahhh. Eddie what’re you still doin’ here?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Ah, just some basic dehydrating of a few fruits and vegetables. MAN ALIVE this thing’s fantastic!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look Eddie, aren’t you forgetting anything?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s right, look I got us a new goldfish. He’s a lot fiestier that the last one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe ’cause the last one was made by Pepperidge Farm. Look Eddie, isn’t there something else you’re supposed to be doing right now?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Well, not unless it’s got something to do with dehydrating my man because right now I’m a dehydrating maniac!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look you have to help me out here. I thought we had a deal. I thought by the time…

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Ah-ah-ah, you know what that is?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your last roommate’s kidney?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: That’s a tomato. This one definitely goes in the display.

content.description: Central Perk. Joey goes up to the bar to order.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Gunther, let me get a lemonade to go.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Lemonade? You ok man?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, it’s career stuff. I don’t know if you heard but they killed off my character on the show.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh, that’s too bad. How’d they do it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I fell down an elevator shaft.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: That sucks. I was buried in an avalanche.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I used to be Bryce on All My Children .

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Chandler is sleeping on the couch. Monica walks by and starts watching him.

content.text: [Chandler wakes up]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Daaahhhh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aaahhhhhhh! Aaahhhh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why must everybody watch me sleep? There’ll be no more watching me sleep, no more watching.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wa-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uuuh.

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. Chandler is returning from Monica and Rachel’s with his bedding. Eddie is standing at the bar with his dehydrator and loads of fruit.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Hey man, check it out, I got some great stuff to dehydrate here. I got some grapes, got some apricots, I thought it would be really cool to see what happens with these water balloons.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Get out. Get out, get out, get out, get out, get out, get out.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You, move out. Take your fruit, your stupid small fruit and GET OUT!

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: You, you want, you want me to move out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: I uh, I gotta tell you man, I mean, that’s uh, it’s kinda out of the blue, I mean don’t you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is not out of the blue, this is smack dab in the middle of the blue.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Ohhhh. Relax, take it easy buddy. Tell me twice, you want me to go? Alright, alright, guess I’ll be back for my stuff. [walks out the door and after a pause comes back in] But if you think for one second I’m leaving you alone with my fish, you’re insane Jack!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You want some help.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: No help required Chico. [reaches into the tank and grabs the fish and puts it in his pocket]

content.description: Joey is at the cab driver interview.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All the way to the airport huh? You know that’s over 30 miles, that’s gonna cost you about so bucks.

content.speaker: Casting Guy
content.text: Excuse me, that’s 50 bucks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Casting Guy
content.text: Five oh dollars.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, you know what it is? It’s smudgy ’cause they’re fax pages. Now when I was on Days of Our Lives as Dr. Drake Remoray, they’d send over the whole script on real paper and everything.

content.speaker: Casting Guy
content.text: That’s great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And, and just so you know, if you wanted to expand this scene like, like have the cab crash or somethin’, I could attend to the victims ’cause I have a background in medical acting.

content.speaker: Casting Guy
content.text: Ok, listen, thanks for coming in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No no, uh, don’t thank me for comin’ in. Uh, at least let me finish. Uh, we could take the expressway but uh, this time of day you’re better off taking the budge. You were goin’ for the word bridge there weren’t ya. I’ll have a good day. [gets up and leaves]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are sitting around the coffee table.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, question number 28, have you ever allowed a lighning bearer to take your wind? I would have to say no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I would have to say pah-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you not remember the puppet guy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah you like totally let him wash his feet in the pool of your inner power.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And his puppet too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah ok, well at least I didn’t let some guy into the forest of my righteous truth on the first date.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Paul.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, ok, ok, moving on, moving on, next question. Ok number 29, have you ever betrayed another goddess for a lightning bearer? Ok, number 30.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Woah, woah, woah, let’s go back to 29.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not uh, not to my recollection.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huuh, alright, Danny Arshak, ninth grade. Oh, c’mon Rach, you know the bottle was totally pointing at me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Only ’cause you took up half the circle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen to you two. It’s so sad. Looks like I’m gonna be going to the goddess meetings alone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well not when they find out you slept with Jason Hurley an hour after he broke up with Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: One hour? You are such a leaf blower.
[Monica goes into her room and slams the door. Rachel does the same. Phoebe, without a door to slam, opens a small chest and slams the lid.]

content.description: Joey’s apartment. Joey is watching movers take all his stuff away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey uh, be careful with that 3-D last supper, Judas is a little loose.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [enters] Oh my God, what’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They’re takin all my stuff back. I guess you were right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No look I wasn’’t right, that’s what I came here to tell you. I was totally hung up on, on my own stuff. Listen, I’m someone who needs the whole security thing, ya know. To know exactly where my next paycheck is coming from buy you, you don’t need that and that’s amazing to me. I could never do what you do Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. And you should hold out for something bigger. I can’t tell you how much respect I have for you not going to that stupid cab driver audition.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I went.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great, how did it go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t get it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re livin’ the dream.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right then.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [movers removing a glass parrot] Oh, not my parrot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t watch this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [approaching the mover holding the parrot] Hey hold on, hold on. How much for the uh, how much to save the bird?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dollars? You spent $1200 dollars on a plastic bird?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhh, I was an impulse buyer, near the register.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go ahead, go ahead with the bird. Ok, do you have anything for around 200?

content.speaker: Mover
content.text: Uh, the dog. [points to a big poecelain greyhound]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Mover
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll take it. My gift to you man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks Ross. I really like that bird though…I’ll take the dog though.

content.description: Central Perk. Monica and Phoebe are sitting ignoring each other. Rachel walks up with two pieces of cake.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here are your cakes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We didn’t order cake.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I know, they’re from me. Look you guys this is not good. I mean we have enough trouble with guys stealing our wind without taking it from each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love you goddesses. I don’t ever want to suck your wind again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. So are we good?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re good?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, let me take these cakes back ’cause they’re gonna take that out of my paycheck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [enters] Ding dong, the psycho’s gone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure this time?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes I actually saw him leave. I mean that guy is standing in the window holding a human head. He is STANDING IN THE WINDOW HOLDING A HUMAN HEAD!

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: [enters] Check it out man, I tore it off some mannaquin in the alley behind Macy’s.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There is no alley behind Macy’s.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: So I got it in the junior miss department, big diff. Anyway check it out man, it’s gonna make a hell of a conversation piece at out next cocktail party, huh pal?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our next cocktail party?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Yeah, you know, put chips in it, we’ll make like a chip chick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eddie, do you remember yesterday?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Uh yes, I think I vaguely recall it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you remember talking to me yesterday?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Uh, yes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what happened?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: We took a road trip to Las Vegas man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh sweet Moses.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So on this road trip, did you guys win any money?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Naah, I crapped out, but Mr. 21 over here he cleans up, 300 bucks, check it out he buys me these new shoes, sweet huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nice.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Yeah. Well see ya upstairs. See ya pals.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is anyone else starting to really like him?

content.description: Hallway outside Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Eddie walks up.

content.text: [Eddie tries his key and it won’t work. He knocks and Chandler answers the door. He’s got the door chained.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: May I help you?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Why doesn’t my key work and what’s all my stuff doin’ downstairs?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m, I’m sorry…[Eddie forces his head in the door] Ahhh. Have we met?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: It’s Eddie you freak, your roommate.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I, I’m sorry, I uh [unchains the door and opens it all the way] I already have a roommate. [Joey turns around in the leather recliner]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, he’s lived here for years, I don’t, I don’t know what you’re talking about man.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: No he, he moved out and I moved in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I, I think we’d remember something like that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know I would.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Well that’s uh, that’s a good point. Um ok, well, uh, I guess I got the wrong apartment then. I, I’m, look, I’m, ya know, I’m sorry, I’m terriably sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey no problem.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See ya. [shuts the door] Goodbuy you fruit drying psychopath. So you want me to help you unpack your stuff?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Na, na I’m ok. Oh and uh, just so you know, I’m not movin’ back in ’cause I have to. Well, I mean, I do have to. It’s just that that place wasn’t really, I mean, this is…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Welcome home man. [they hug and jump around]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A little foos?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Absolutely.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What happened to the foosball?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah that’s a cantelope.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. They are hauling out the porcelain dog from Joey’s room. Chandler is holding the dog by the rear in a rather interesting position.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey look, are we gonna have to bring this out every time Ross comes over?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He paid a lot of money for it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna hold him a different way. Look I don’t understand, if you hated it so much, why did you buy it in the first place?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I had a whole ceramic zoo thing goin’ over there but now, without the other ones, it just looks tacky.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So is he housetrained or is he gonna leave little bathroom tiles all over the place? Stay. Good, STAY! Good fake dog.
